label: AB_oC8_67_a_g-001
title: $\alpha$-FeSe Structure
comments:
We follow (Louca, 2010) in calling this $\alpha$-FeSe. While some authorities list this as a prototype of \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_oC8_67_a_g-002}{$\alpha$-PbO}, we find that the difference in structures is enough to warrant giving FeSe its own prototype. 
 (Louca, 2010) note that ``the Se ion concentration is close to 1.'' 
 The data is presented for the structure at 7 K. 
 The ICSD entry is from the (Lehman, 2010) conference proceedings. 
 (Louca, 2010) find $a \approx b$. As with \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_oC8_67_a_g-002}{orthorhombic $\alpha$-PbO} and \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_tP4_129_a_c-001}{tetragonal ($B10$) PbO}, this causes AFLOW to place this in the tetragonal $P4/nmm$ \#129 space group if the default settings are used. The experimentally reported structure is only obtained if we use the command 
 aflow -{-}proto=AB\_oC8\_67\_a\_g -{-}tolerance=0.001 -{-}params=a,c/a,z$_{2}$ . 
 \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_oC8_67_a_g-001}{$\alpha$-FeSe} and \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_oC8_67_a_g-002}{$\alpha$-PbO} have the same AFLOW prototype label, AB\_oC8\_67\_a\_g. They are generated by the same symmetry operations with different sets of parameters ({\tt --params}) specified in their corresponding CIF files.
